title: Ticket #4160: Python bindings cannot send daemon target to master
description:
The python bindings send only the first character of the daemon target to the master, instead of the full string. So, the following script: 

import htcondor
master = htcondor.Collector().locate(htcondor.DaemonTypes.Master)
htcondor.send_command(master, htcondor.DaemonCommands.DaemonOff, "startd")

Would really only send the character "s" as the target, not "startd".

TimT - can you review and cherry-pick back to 8.0.x series if necessary (I don't recall when 'send_command' was added)?
